Create a vector or dataframe with case insensitive name matching.

Source: R/insensitive.R
insensitive.Rd

Create a vector or dataframe with case insensitive name matching.

insensitive(x)

Arguments

x

vector or dataframe to modify.

Acknowledgment

Thanks to Neil Richardson for recommending this function (https://twitter.com/enpiar).

See also

httr::insensitive().

Other functions for developers: check_crucial_names, exists_in_pkg, extract_insensitive, is_multiple, nms_pull_matches, rename_matches, round_any

Other general functions to deal with names: extract_insensitive, name_dfs, nms_pull_matches, rename_matches

Examples

x <- c("abc" = 1, "def" = 2)
x["ABC"]
#> <NA> 
#>   NA 
y <- insensitive(x)
y["ABC"]
#> abc 
#>   1 
y[["ABC"]]
#> [1] 1
y$ABC
#> [1] 1

vft <- data.frame(TreeID = 1)
insensitive(vft)[["TreeID"]]
#> [1] 1
insensitive(vft)[["treeid"]]
#> [1] 1
insensitive(vft)["TreeID"]
#>   treeid
#> 1      1
insensitive(vft)["treeid"]
#>   treeid
#> 1      1
insensitive(vft)$TreeID
#> [1] 1
insensitive(vft)$treeid
#> [1] 1

# Works
transform(insensitive(vft), new = treeid)
#>   treeid new
#> 1      1   1
# dplyr::mutate(insensitive(vft), new = treeid)
# Fails
# transform(insensitive(vft), new = TreeID)
# dplyr::mutate(insensitive(vft), new = TreeID)
